dashboard.description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/661851573 at Wed Jul 29 14:15:52 UTC 2020

panels.content:
This graphs show the frontend services that GitLab customer traffic will be initially handled by. Any issues in this
fleet are more likely to be user-impacting.
panels.title: Help

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

targets.expr:
min by (type) (min_over_time(gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="main",type="web"}[$__interval]))
or
min by (type) (min_over_time(gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="main",type="web"}[$__interval]))

avg by (type) (avg_over_time(gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="main",type="web"}[$__interval]))
or
avg by (type) (avg_over_time(gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="main",type="web"}[$__interval]))

(1 - 6 * (1 - avg(slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{type="web"})))
or
avg(slo:min:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{type="web"})

(1 - 14.4 * (1 - avg(slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{type="web"})))
or
(2 * avg(slo:min:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{type="web"}) - 1)

min by (type) (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="main",type="web"} offset 1w)
or
min by (type) (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="main",type="web"} offset 1w)

panels.title: Latency: Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{environment="$environment",stage="main",type="web"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{environment="$environment",stage="main",type="web"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="web"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{environment="$environment",stage="main",type="web"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="web"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_30m{environment="$environment",stage="main",type="web"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="web"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_6h{environment="$environment",stage="main",type="web"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="web"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions within a minute period. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

targets.expr:
clamp_max(
  max by (type) (max_over_time(gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="main",type="web"}[$__interval]))
  or
  sum by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="main",type="web"}),
  1
)

clamp_max(
  avg by (type) (avg_over_time(gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="main",type="web"}[$__interval])),
  1
)

(6 * avg(slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{type="web"}))
or
avg(slo:max:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{type="web"})

(14.4 * avg(slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{type="web"}))
or
(2 * avg(slo:max:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{type="web"}))

max by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="main",type="web"} offset 1w)
or
sum by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="main",type="web"} offset 1w)

panels.title: Error Ratios

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{environment="$environment",stage="main",type="web"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{environment="$environment",stage="main",type="web"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="web"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{environment="$environment",stage="main",type="web"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="web"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{environment="$environment",stage="main",type="web"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="web"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{environment="$environment",stage="main",type="web"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="web"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

targets.expr:
avg by (type)
(avg_over_time(gitlab_service_ops:rate_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="main",type="web"}[$__interval]) or avg_over_time(gitlab_service_ops:rate{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="main",type="web"}[$__interval]))
or
sum by (type) (gitlab_service_ops:rate_5m{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="main",type="web"} or gitlab_service_ops:rate{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="main",type="web"})

avg by (type) (
  gitlab_service_ops:rate_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="main",type="web"} offset 1w
  or
  gitlab_service_ops:rate{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="main",type="web"} offset 1w
)
or
sum by (type) (
  gitlab_service_ops:rate_5m{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="main",type="web"} offset 1w
  or
  gitlab_service_ops:rate{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="main",type="web"} offset 1w
)

panels.title: RPS - Service Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.

Git: git ssh and https traffic

targets.expr:
clamp_max(
  max by (type) (max_over_time(gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="main",type="ci-runners"}[$__interval]))
  or
  sum by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="main",type="ci-runners"}),
  1
)

clamp_max(
  avg by (type) (avg_over_time(gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="main",type="ci-runners"}[$__interval])),
  1
)

(6 * avg(slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{type="ci-runners"}))
or
avg(slo:max:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{type="ci-runners"})

(14.4 * avg(slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{type="ci-runners"}))
or
(2 * avg(slo:max:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{type="ci-runners"}))

max by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="main",type="ci-runners"} offset 1w)
or
sum by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="main",type="ci-runners"} offset 1w)

panels.title: Error Ratios

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{environment="$environment",stage="main",type="ci-runners"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{environment="$environment",stage="main",type="ci-runners"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="ci-runners"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{environment="$environment",stage="main",type="ci-runners"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="ci-runners"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{environment="$environment",stage="main",type="ci-runners"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="ci-runners"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{environment="$environment",stage="main",type="ci-runners"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="ci-runners"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

targets.expr:
avg by (type)
(avg_over_time(gitlab_service_ops:rate_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="main",type="ci-runners"}[$__interval]) or avg_over_time(gitlab_service_ops:rate{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="main",type="ci-runners"}[$__interval]))
or
sum by (type) (gitlab_service_ops:rate_5m{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="main",type="ci-runners"} or gitlab_service_ops:rate{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="main",type="ci-runners"})

avg by (type) (
  gitlab_service_ops:rate_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="main",type="ci-runners"} offset 1w
  or
  gitlab_service_ops:rate{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="main",type="ci-runners"} offset 1w
)
or
sum by (type) (
  gitlab_service_ops:rate_5m{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="main",type="ci-runners"} offset 1w
  or
  gitlab_service_ops:rate{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="main",type="ci-runners"} offset 1w
)

panels.title: RPS - Service Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.
panels.title: Saturation

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

targets.expr:
min by (type) (min_over_time(gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="main",type="registry"}[$__interval]))
or
min by (type) (min_over_time(gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="main",type="registry"}[$__interval]))

avg by (type) (avg_over_time(gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="main",type="registry"}[$__interval]))
or
avg by (type) (avg_over_time(gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="main",type="registry"}[$__interval]))

(1 - 6 * (1 - avg(slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{type="registry"})))
or
avg(slo:min:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{type="registry"})

(1 - 14.4 * (1 - avg(slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{type="registry"})))
or
(2 * avg(slo:min:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{type="registry"}) - 1)

min by (type) (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="main",type="registry"} offset 1w)
or
min by (type) (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="main",type="registry"} offset 1w)

panels.title: Latency: Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{environment="$environment",stage="main",type="registry"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{environment="$environment",stage="main",type="registry"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="registry"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{environment="$environment",stage="main",type="registry"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="registry"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_30m{environment="$environment",stage="main",type="registry"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="registry"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_6h{environment="$environment",stage="main",type="registry"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="registry"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions within a minute period. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

targets.expr:
clamp_max(
  max by (type) (max_over_time(gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="main",type="registry"}[$__interval]))
  or
  sum by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="main",type="registry"}),
  1
)

clamp_max(
  avg by (type) (avg_over_time(gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="main",type="registry"}[$__interval])),
  1
)

or
sum by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="main",type="registry"} offset 1w)

panels.title: RPS - Service Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.
panels.title: Saturation

panels.content:
# GitLab Public Dashboards

Welcome to the GitLab public dashboard. GitLab [values transparency](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/values/#transparency),
so we maintain a public copy of our internal dashboards.

Due to privacy reasons and more strict query limitations not all dashboards may work correctly.
panels.title: Welcome

panels.content:
# Useful Links

* **[Platform Triage Dashboard](/d/general-triage/general-platform-triage?orgId=1)** technical overview for all services.
* **[Capacity Planning Dashboard](/d/general-capacity-planning/general-capacity-planning?orgId=1)** resources currently saturated, or at risk of becoming saturated.
* **[Service SLA Dashboard](/d/general-slas/general-slas?orgId=1)** service SLA tracking.
* **[Source repository for these dashboards](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/tree/master/dashboards)** - interested in how we use [grafonnet-lib](https://github.com/grafana/grafonnet-lib)
  to build our dashboards?
panels.title: Welcome

dashboard.title: general: GitLab Dashboards
